thread.title: AFL and NRL grand finals, a Barangaroo picnic, Adelaide Wine Show and Rolf de Heer movie - your weekend sorted | Executive Living |
thread.title_full: AFL and NRL grand finals, a Barangaroo picnic, Adelaide Wine Show and Rolf de Heer movie - your weekend sorted | Executive Living | The Australian

author: The Australian
title: AFL and NRL grand finals, a Barangaroo picnic, Adelaide Wine Show and Rolf de Heer movie - your weekend sorted | Executive Living |
text:
Is there anything else on in Melbourne, other than the AFL grand final? Well, yes, there’s the annual MCG open day , where you can have a kick of the footy on the MCG turf, and visit the usually off-limits parts of the stadium, including the famous MCC Long Room and the player change rooms. Imagine yourself strapping on the boots the day before! MCG, Sunday, free. mcg.org.au Paul Grabowsky plays at the NGV, not to be confused with the MCG. Source: News Corp Australia
Friday nights at NGV. If you’re not into football, you must be into jazz, right? And Russian art collections? If so, tonight is your lucky night. Paul Grabowsky, Australia’s best jazz musician, is playing at the NGV; tickets include exclusive after-hours access to the magnificent Hermitage: The legacy of Catherine the Great exhibition. ngv.vic.gov.au
PERTH
The AFL grand final , between Hawthorn and the West Coast Eagles, will be shown live on the big screens at Domain Stadium. Picnic blankets are encouraged. BYO alcohol (restrictions apply). Win or lose, welcome the team home to Domain Staduim from midday on Sunday. Entry on both days is free.
ADELAIDE (from Adealide bureau chief Michael Owen)
Semaphore Music Festival . Bring the family down to the Semaphore foreshore for a chilled out long weekend of sun, sea air, food and live music. Local and interstate musicians performing folk, acoustic, indie-rock and rockabilly. It starts on Friday at 7pm, Saturday and Sunday from noon and Monday from noon. Tickets from $10. semaphoremusicfestival.com
Gypsy Dragon Laneway Bar. The latest addition to Adelaide’s hip network of small, laneway bars, the Gypsy Dragon, opens to the public tonight. Live music, DJs, premium beers and spirits, and a wall full of graffiti. Find it off Topham Mall.
AsiaFest. Exquisite and exotic Asian food teamed with traditional beverages and entertainment, set in beautiful Rymill Park, in the heart of Adelaide. Something for everyone: Adelaide’s best restaurants, entertainment and children’s programs. asiafest.com.au
Royal Adelaide Wine Show. Pour your own tastings from a selection of over 2000 wines entered in the 2015 Royal Adelaide Wine Show, including the Trophy & Medal winners for this year. Inclusive of your ticket, you will receive the official Catalogue of Results, a Royal Adelaide Wine Show wine glass to keep and cocktail food on the evening. Friday 2nd October 2015 6pm — 8pm Wayville Pavilion, Adelaide Showground. $70 per person. thewineshow.com.au Picnic at Barangaroo. Source: News Corp Australia
SYDNEY (from food editor Necia Wilden)
Barangaroo Giant Picnic. Bring a picnic blanket and grab a spot on Stargazer Lawn but leave the hamper at home; this is one picnic where the guest chefs do all the work. Talent includes Colin Fassnidge from 4Fourteen serving suckling pig rolls and Joel Best of Bondi’s Best dishing up fish and chips. Sunday, Oct 4, 11am-5pm. www.barangaroo.sydney
NRL Nation. Meet past and present players from all 16 NRL clubs, and join in skills tests and training sessions. Today and tomorrow. nrl.com/nrl-nation . The grand final is on at Homebush on Sunday, kicking off at 7.15pm. But should it even be played in Sydney? Queensland great Glen Lazarus told ABC Radio today that the game, between the Cowboys and Broncos, both Queensland teams, was “a really good incentive in the future for grand finals to be held in Queensland - we are the hub of rugby league.”
DARWIN (from Frances Grant)
Light moves. This Australian contemporary video show, from the National Gallery of Australia, opens on Saturday at MAGNT. Curator Anne O’Heir is doing a tour of the exhibition at 11am.
Another Country. The latest movie from David Gulpilil and Rolf de Heer is screening at the Deckchair Cinema tonight. Cold Chisel, The Perfect Crime . Source: Supplied
MUSIC (from Stephen Fitzpatrick)
Cold Chisel ’s eighth studio album, The Perfect Crime , is “unabashedly a rock and roll album but there are the usual Chisel stylistic excursions”, including hints of Latino, brooding moments and even a touch of disco. “At some point in your life, you realise you’ve discovered Cold Chisel. It’s just a matter of when.” Read the full review in Review tomorrow. 4.5 stars
Deniliquin Ute Muster. Cold Chisel headline the Deni Ute Muster tonight. Lee Kernaghan headlines tomorrow night. deniutemuster.com.au Emily Blunt in Sicario . Source: Supplied
CINEMA (from Stephen Romei)
Sicario. The realism of this heart-pounding action movie about the Mexican drug trade grips from the start and doesn’t let go. Emily Blunt, as FBI agent Kate Macer, is brave, highly trained and dedicated, but she is still in way over her head among ruthless and intimidating criminals capable of perpetrating horror. This is not a feelgood film, but it is superb. Four stars.
